channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Trump ally Nigel Farage elected to British parliament for first time
item.description: After seven failed attempts, Nigel Farage has won a seat in the U.K.'s parliament.

item.title: India and China to 'redouble' efforts for resolving border issues 'at the earliest'
item.description: India and China have agreed to double down on efforts to improve talks regarding their long-drawn out border issues.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei 225 declines after hitting fresh all-time highs as Asia markets mostly fall
item.description: Both the Nikkei and the the broad-based Topix faltered and dipped from their record highs earlier in the session.

item.title: Nigel Farage's right-wing Reform UK party shocks with significant gains expected
item.description: The projected success of the right-wing Reform UK party, led by Brexiteer Nigel Farage, has surprised pollsters and the political establishment.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: UK Labour landslide victory, exit poll says
item.description: The center-left Labour Party is projected to win the U.K. election by a landslide, according to an exit poll, ending 14 years of Conservative rule.

item.title: Who is Labour's Keir Starmer, the new leader of Britain?
item.description: The 61-year-old human rights lawyer-turned-politician has had a rapid ascent after entering parliament less than a decade ago.

item.title: U.S. named the worst place for British families to move abroad. Here's why
item.description: The U.S. comes in last in a ranking of 28 countries, dragged down by high childcare costs, long work hours and lack of federally mandated paid parental leave.

item.title: China-built EVs hit with EU tariffs; Nio says it may have to raise prices in Europe
item.description: Europe on Thursday confirmed tariff increases on electric vehicles imported from China to the continent with automakers criticizing the move.

item.title: Bitcoin slides to two-month low as Fed signals it's not ready to cut rates yet
item.description: Bitcoin on Thursday fell below the $57,000 mark for the first time since May 1, according to data from crypto ranking site CoinGecko.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: An education scandal years in the making
item.description: Remote learning technology could potentially help lower instances of cheating or prove to exacerbate it.

item.title: China faces economic headwinds as it grapples with an aging — and shrinking — population
item.description: Birth rates are falling around the world as women choose to have children later, or not at all.

item.title: China hopes to reach a solution with the EU on EV tariffs 'as soon as possible'
item.description: China's Ministry of Commerce said it hoped to reach an agreement soon with the European Union on the bloc's planned tariffs for imported Chinese electric cars.

item.title: Novo Nordisk shares shrug off concerns over study linking weight loss drugs to rare eye condition
item.description: Novo Nordisk investors appeared unperturbed Thursday by a critical Harvard report that linked weight loss drugs to a rare eye condition.

item.title: Saks Fifth Avenue parent HBC to acquire Neiman Marcus Group in $2.65 billion deal
item.description: The deal will establish Saks Global, which will include Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH, Neiman Marcus' namesake department store chain and Bergdorf Goodman.

item.title: SoftBank stock hits its first record high in 24 years — Arm and AI helped it get there
item.description: SoftBank shares have been boosted by the improved financial performance in the Vision Fund and by a rally in the stock of chip designer Arm.

item.title: Fed says it's not ready to cut rates until 'greater confidence' inflation is moving to 2% goal
item.description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its June 11-12 meeting.

item.title: What are the best galleries in London? Artists choose their favorites
item.description: CNBC asked a mix of artists to name their favorite public and commercial galleries to visit in London — large or small.

item.title: 'They want out': This company helps Americans experiment with expat living
item.description: Americans hoping to move abroad are getting some help from travel companies and local guides.

item.title: China leads the patents race for generative AI, with Tencent and Baidu topping the list
item.description: China filed more than 38,000 of generative AI patents between 2014 to 2023, a new United Nations report on Thursday showed.

item.title: No God, no big ads and no age debate: The UK election race is very different to America's
item.description: The U.K. and U.S. have a lot in common. But when it comes to politics, the Brits do things very differently from their American friends.

item.title: Delta goes pasta-only for thousands of international travelers after 'spoiled' food forced a flight to divert
item.description: Delta said it was serving pasta only on about 75 international flights on Wednesday after a 'spoiled meal' forced an Amsterdam-bound flight to divert.

item.title: Hong Kong's IPO market is finally starting to turn around, consulting firm EY says
item.description: The market for initial public offerings in Hong Kong is set to improve significantly over the next five years, said George Chan, global IPO leader at EY.

item.title: Biden tells ally he's weighing whether to stay in the race: Reports
item.description: The reported conversation with the ally came amid the fallout from Biden's devastating presidential debate with Trump.

item.title: Vice President Kamala Harris' past donors privately strategize in case Biden drops out
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris' allies discuss scenarios in the event that President Joe Biden decides not to keep his reelection campaign going.

item.title: McDonald's shortens breakfast hours in Australia in response to nationwide egg shortage
item.description: Australia is facing an egg supply crunch thanks to bird flu outbreaks — and it's led McDonald's to trim breakfast hours by 90 minutes.

item.title: Six NYC hotels are providing free helicopter airport transfers into the city — with one small catch
item.description: Free transfers are available from John F. Kennedy International Airport and Newark Liberty International Airport for guests staying in select suites this summer.

item.title: Is inflation Biden's or Trump's fault? The answer isn't so simple, economists say
item.description: Biden and Trump traded barbs on the state of the U.S. economy during their first debate. But who or what is really responsible for inflation?

item.title: Romance scams cost consumers $1.14 billion last year. It's a 'more insidious' fraud, expert says
item.description: Cyber criminals are tapping into wealth accounts through human connection. Here's how to spot it and cut ties as soon as you can.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl breaks records in devastating path across the Caribbean
item.description: The hurricane has set a string of records that experts say are tied to climate change, as it developed faster and much earlier in the year.

item.title: Tesla stock rises again after better-than-expected deliveries report
item.description: Tesla shares saw more gains Wednesday, after jumping 10% in the previous session.
